languages.name: BDD
languages.description: Decision DAGs with boolean branching on variables

languages.name: d-NNF
languages.description: NNF with determinism: disjuncts are logically disjoint

languages.name: DNNF
languages.description: NNF with decomposability: conjuncts do not share variables

languages.name: f-NNF
languages.description: NNF with flatness: height at most 2

languages.name: FBDD
languages.description: BDD without a fixed variable ordering (free order)

languages.name: IP
languages.description: Representation by the set of prime implicants

languages.name: NNF
languages.description: Boolean formulas where negation appears only at the literal level

languages.name: OBDD
languages.description: BDD with a fixed variable ordering

languages.name: OBDD<
languages.description: OBDDs under a specific ordering constraint (<)

languages.name: PI
languages.description: Representation by the set of prime implicates

languages.name: s-NNF
languages.description: NNF with smoothness: disjuncts mention the same set of variables

languages.name: sd-DNNF
languages.fullName: Smooth Deterministic Decomposable Negation Normal Form

references.bibtex:
@article{Darwiche_2002,
   title={A Knowledge Compilation Map},
   volume={17},
   ISSN={1076-9757},
   url={http://dx.doi.org/10.1613/jair.989},
   DOI={10.1613/jair.989},
   journal={Journal of Artificial Intelligence Research},
   publisher={AI Access Foundation},
   author={Darwiche, A. and Marquis, P.},
   year={2002},
   month=sep, pages={229–264} }

relationTypes.name: No Poly, Unknown Quasi
relationTypes.label: ⊄_p, ?≤_q
relationTypes.description: No polynomial transformation, quasi-polynomial unknown (A ⊄_p B and A ?≤_q B)

relationTypes.name: No Poly, Has Quasi
relationTypes.label: ⊄_p, ≤_q
relationTypes.description: No polynomial but quasi-polynomial exists (A ⊄_p B and A ≤_q B)

relationTypes.name: Unknown Poly, Has Quasi
relationTypes.label: ?≤_p, ≤_q
relationTypes.description: Polynomial unknown but quasi-polynomial exists (A ?≤_p B and A ≤_q B)

relationTypes.name: Both Unknown
relationTypes.label: ?≤_p, ?≤_q
relationTypes.description: Both polynomial and quasi-polynomial unknown (A ?≤_p B and A ?≤_q B)

relationTypes.name: Not Polynomial
relationTypes.label: ⊄_p
relationTypes.description: Not polynomial (generated by "Polytime vs not polytime" filter)

smoothness.label: Smoothness
smoothness.description: All disjuncts mention the same variables

read-once.label: Read-Once
read-once.description: Each variable appears at most once on any path

CO.label: Consistency
CO.description: Check if the formula is satisfiable

VA.label: Validity
VA.description: Check if the formula is a tautology

CE.label: Clausal Entailment
CE.description: Check if a clause is entailed

IM.label: Implicant
IM.description: Find an implicant of the formula

EQ.label: Equivalence
EQ.description: Check logical equivalence of two formulas

SE.label: Sentential Entailment
SE.description: Check if one formula entails another

CT.label: Model Counting
CT.description: Count the number of satisfying assignments

not-poly-conditional.label: Not Poly (Conditional)
not-poly-conditional.description: Not polynomial under complexity assumption (e.g., Unless P=NP)

matrix.description: CNF to DNF lacks polynomial algorithm; quasi status open.

separatingFunctions.name: Clique Detection Instances
separatingFunctions.description: Clique encodings separate CNF from succinct DNF representations without super-polynomial blowups.

matrix.description: CNF to DNNF in polynomial time (placeholder).
CNF to NNF in polynomial time.
d-DNNF to DNF quasi-polynomial; polynomial open.
d-DNNF to DNNF in polynomial time.
d-DNNF to PI only quasi-polynomial.
DNF to CNF lacks polynomial algorithm; quasi status open.

separatingFunctions.name: Parity Formulas
separatingFunctions.description: Parity families require exponentially many CNF clauses when starting from compact DNF witnesses.

matrix.description: DNF to d-DNNF believed exponential.

separatingFunctions.name: Hidden Weighted Bit
separatingFunctions.description: Hidden weighted bit functions resist structured DNNF compilation of DNF inputs.

matrix.description: DNF to DNNF complexity unknown.
DNF to IP believed exponential.

separatingFunctions.name: Knapsack Constraints
separatingFunctions.description: Knapsack-style pseudo-Boolean constraints separate DNF from succinct integer programming encodings.

matrix.description: DNF to NNF in polynomial time.
DNNF to CNF lacks quasi-polynomial compilation.

separatingFunctions.name: Parity Constraints
separatingFunctions.description: Families of parity formulas force exponential CNF representations compared with DNNF.

separatingFunctions.name: Tseitin Grid Formulas
separatingFunctions.description: Tseitin contradictions remain succinct in DNNF but require super-polynomial CNF lower bounds.

matrix.description: DNNF to d-DNNF in polynomial time.
DNNF to DNF complexity unknown.
DNNF to FBDD lacks polynomial algorithm; quasi status open.
DNNF to NNF in polynomial time.
DNNF to structured DNNF complexity unknown.
Flat NNF to NNF in polynomial time.
FBDD to DNNF in polynomial time.
FBDD to NNF in polynomial time.
IP to DNF in polynomial time.
IP to NNF in polynomial time.
IP to PI complexity unknown.
MODS to NNF in polynomial time.
NNF to CNF only quasi-polynomial.

separatingFunctions.name: Tseitin-style Encodings
separatingFunctions.description: Tseitin grids force super-polynomial CNF blowup from compact NNF representations.

matrix.description: NNF to DNF quasi-polynomial; polynomial open.
NNF to DNNF lacks quasi-polynomial compilation.

separatingFunctions.name: XOR Tree Formulas
separatingFunctions.description: XOR tree structures require decomposition not achievable with quasi-polynomial blowup.

matrix.description: NNF to flat NNF requires quasi-polynomial resources.

separatingFunctions.name: High-Depth Circuits
separatingFunctions.description: High-depth formulas force quasipolynomial overhead when flattening NNF to flat NNF.

matrix.description: NNF to FBDD requires quasi-polynomial resources.

separatingFunctions.name: AND-tree Structures
separatingFunctions.description: AND-tree formulas resist FBDD representation with quasi-polynomial overhead.

matrix.description: NNF to IP lacks polynomial algorithm; quasi status open.

separatingFunctions.name: Hard ILP Instances
separatingFunctions.description: Integer programming problems with exponential NNF-to-IP overhead witness superpolynomial separation.

matrix.description: NNF to MODS quasi-polynomial; polynomial open.
NNF to smooth NNF requires quasi-polynomial resources.

separatingFunctions.name: Imbalanced NNF Formulas
separatingFunctions.description: Imbalanced formulas require quasi-polynomial smoothing overhead.

matrix.description: OBDD to FBDD in polynomial time.
OBDD to OBDD<LT in polynomial time.
OBDD to PI lacks polynomial algorithm; quasi status open.

separatingFunctions.name: Binary Adder Circuits
separatingFunctions.description: Adder circuits resist polynomial OBDD-to-PI transformation.

PI to d-DNNF in polynomial time.
PI to IP complexity unknown.
PI to OBDD quasi-polynomial; polynomial open.
PI to structured DNNF in polynomial time.
Smooth NNF to NNF in polynomial time.
Structured DNNF to DNNF in polynomial time.
